settings.heading: Water Chiller Specifications
settings.content:
• Powerful water cooling to 37°F or heating up to 104°F
  • All-weather resilient: use indoors and outdoors.
  • NSF50 certified 20-micron step filtration.
  • UV sanitation
  • Smartphone Wi-Fi-enabled App Control.
  • Military-grade high-quality components.
  • Wheels and 2 handles for portability.
  • Built-in self-priming pump.
  • 1 Year included Warranty


Size & Weight

  • Weight: 114 lbs
  • Size: 25.6 x 17.9 x 18.9 inches
  • Shipping weight: 120 lbs
    (travels in a reinforced wooden box)

    Technical Specifications:
  • Power: 1.5 HP (9000 BTU/hour)
  • Refrigerating Capacity: 3500 W
  • Heating Power: 5000 W (pump included)
  • Pump Power: 80 W
  • Pump Lift: 53 ft
  • Pump Flow: 634 gallons per hour
  • Refrigerant Fluid: R410A (Eco-Friendly)
  • Input Current: 8.75A
  • Input Power: 850W
  • Voltage: 110V / 60h (US Standard)
  • Noice: < 65DB (A)
  • Safety shutoff


Proprietary Design Advantages

  • Rapid Cooling system: engineered for 50% improved air exchange and water flow efficiency (typically the main culprit of other chillers).
  • Latest r420 and r32 Dual-Compatible Compressor, tested to perform up to 50% better and last 70% longer.
  • Titanium Heat Exchangers ensure maximum heat transfer, longevity & resistance to corrosion.
  • L-shaped Condensers reduce loss, improve efficiency and decrease maintenance.
  • Reinforced hoses, wheels & extra handles.
  • Multiple inner components using higher quality materials.
  • Powder-coated finish to reduce scratches.

settings.heading: XL Ice Bath Specifications
settings.content:

  • High-quality, drop stitch skin-friendly material built for durability
  • 120 gal water capacity
  • Designed for indoor and outdoor use
  • Suitable heights up to 6'9"
  • Sized up to 2 people
  • High pressure structure - 8 PSI / 0.55 Bar
  • Tub weight: 15 lbs
  • 1/2" water inlet and outlet

settings.heading: Why choose an ice bath?
settings.text: Ice baths reduce inflammation, speed up recovery, and build mental toughness. A proven way to boost your health, fitness, and strength.

settings.heading: Warrior Willpower Vs Others
What is your shipping time?
settings.row_content:
The shipping is free.

The 1.5 hp water chiller delivery time is 7 - 14 business days.

The ice bath is delivered in 2 - 6 business days to mainland US.

settings.heading: Is this water chiller going to hike up my electricity bill?
settings.row_content:
No, the chiller will not rack up high energy bills. It uses the same technology as your fridge/freezer at home, which is extremely economical.

The exact power usage varies based on climate but expect to spend around $0.5-$1.5 per day in electricity (10 times less than buying ice if you plunge regularly!).

One of the best long term investments for your health and your family.

settings.heading: How often I should change the water filter?
settings.row_content: We recommend changing the water filter once every 1 - 2 months.

settings.heading: Can I use the chiller outdoors?
settings.row_content:
Definitely! We engineered the chiller to be weather and UV resistant, so you can set it up inside or outside.

The chiller is waterproof, so you can freely use it outside and don't have to cover it with anything.

settings.heading: What temperatures can the water chiller achieve?
settings.row_content: The Water Chiller can cool water to an exhilarating 79 F without the need for adding ice.

settings.heading: Is the water chiller noisy?
settings.row_content: The water chiller is designed for quiet operation. We've prioritized ensuring that your cold plunge sessions are as peaceful as possible. Thanks to our advanced engineering, the chiller operates with minimal noise, allowing you to relax and rejuvenate without any disruptions, making it a top choice for both indoor and outdoor use.

settings.heading: How cold or warm the chiller can keep the water?
settings.row_content: The chiller/heater can keep the water at a steady 37 - 40 F whilst filtering and keeping your water clean. It can warm it up to 104 F.

settings.heading: How long it takes to cool down the water?
settings.row_content: The chiller cools down the water to 39 in about 2 - 3 hours. It depends how much water volume there is inside the tub and your climate as well.

settings.heading: Is it easy to setup?
settings.row_content:
The ice bath assembly takes less than 10 minutes and is super easy. Just inflate it with the pump and you are ready.

The chiller takes about 10 minutes as well - plug the hoses in the ice bath and that is it. We include a video setup guide with your purchase.

settings.heading: What is the ice bath size?
settings.row_content:
• Dimensions: 60"L x 31"W x 26"H
  • High-quality, drop stitch skin-friendly material built for durability
  • 120 gal water capacity
  • Designed for indoor and outdoor use
  • Suitable for up to 6'9"
  • Sized up to 2 people at the same time

settings.heading: Does the ice bath come with a lid?
settings.row_content:
Yes, it does!

It comes complete with an insulated inflatable lid. You will find it carefully folded inside the box.

settings.heading: Can you fit 2 people in the XL ice bath?
settings.row_content:
Yes, you can!

You can comfortably fit two in the bath at the same time, facing each other.

settings.heading: I am over 6ft, will I fit?
settings.row_content: We've designed our bath to fit anyone up to 6'9".

settings.heading: How do I drain the ice bath?
settings.row_content:
The XL Ice Bath has a drain tap at the bottom, so you can easily drain it. Just unplug the chiller if it is connected and the water will be drained.

We also include taps so you can stop the water if you don't want to use the chiller.

settings.heading: How often should I change the water?
settings.row_content:
Whenever you notice that it is dirty. Usually once every 4 - 8 weeks. We recommend washing the inside surfaces with warm soapy water or mild disinfectant after you drain it.

Also, we recommend washing your legs before taking a cold plunge and keeping the ice bath lid on when not using.

settings.heading: How do I keep the water clean for longer?
settings.row_content:
Always keep the lid on when not in use, to help prevent any debris from falling in.

Also, you can apply hydrogen peroxide and chlorine tablets or water sanitizer.

settings.heading: What is the recommended water temperature for cold plunge?
settings.row_content: We recommend starting out at around 59º Fahrenheit (15°C) if it's your first time, and then slowly lowering the temperature and duration for each session. That way your body will get acclimated to the cold.

settings.heading: FAQ
Enhances Your Physical Recovery
settings.row_content: A meta-analysis of cold-water immersion effects on recovery found that cold exposure can be a highly effective recovery tool after high-intensity exercise or endurance training. Short interval (< 5 mins), cold water immersion demonstrated positive outcomes for muscle power, perceived recovery, and decreased muscle soreness (in part due to a reduction in circulating creatine kinases).

settings.heading: Elevates Your Mood And Energy
settings.row_content: Cold exposure causes the prolonged release of dopamine. Dopamine is a powerful molecule capable of elevating mood, enhancing focus, attention, goal-directed behavior, etc. Even short bouts of cold exposure can cause a lasting increase in dopamine and sustained elevation of mood, energy, and focus.

settings.heading: Increases Your Metabolism
settings.row_content: Cold exposure increases metabolism as the body has to burn calories to increase core body temperature. The conversion of white fat (energy storage) to beige or brown fat (which are highly metabolically active) can be beneficial for triggering further and more sustained increases in metabolism

settings.heading: Reduces Stress
settings.row_content: By forcing yourself to embrace the stress of cold exposure as a meaningful self-directed challenge (i.e., stressor), you exert what is called 'top-down control' over deeper brain centers that regulate reflexive states. This top-down control process involves your prefrontal cortex – an area of your brain involved in planning and suppressing impulsivity. That 'top-down' control is the basis of what people refer to when they talk about "resilience and grit." Importantly, it is a skill that carries over to situations outside of the deliberate cold environment, allowing you to cope better and maintain a calm, clear mind when confronted with real-world stressors. In other words, deliberate cold exposure is great training for the mind.

settings.heading: Improves The Quality Of Your Sleep
settings.row_content: Cold exposure can have significant effects on your circadian rhythm and quality of sleep. The circadian rhythm is the body's natural internal clock that regulates sleep and wakefulness. Exposure to cold can help regulate the circadian rhythm by promoting the release of the hormone melatonin, which is critical for the sleep-wake cycle. In terms of sleep quality, exposure to cold temperatures can increase the amount of slow-wave sleep, which is the deep, restorative sleep that is critical for physical and mental health

settings.heading: Health Benefits of Ice Baths
